Title: Buy this camera, Do it
Cons: Wish the camera had a light for movie recording.
Pros: Great for someone who just wants to snap pictures.  Very easy to use.  Small size is a plus too. Like the ability to plug into TV and view pics and movies off of the camera.
Comments: I would purchase this camera again.

Title: Sweet Action!!
Cons: Small zoom capability, but that is offset by the 7.2 MP, which allows editing later
Pros: I love the ability of this camera to turn on, focus, and take the pic quickly. I needed a smaller yet capable camera to capture stuff at work, something I could stuff in my pocket, and yet have ready quickly. Plenty of features for anyone who doesn't make a living in photography, and I have gotten many, many compliments on the pics already. Sturdy camera, and Sony has NEVER given me problems with a camera!
Comments: I have owned a Sony F717 for 4 years, which I intend to keep and continue using, and this model has many well-thought out improvements over that model.  I especially like being able to just use my memory sticks from my other camera interchangeably.  Sony has done well with this camera.

Title: Amazing Deal
Cons: A little small for me, but that isn't too bad
Pros:
Great Quality
Steady Shot
I love the red projection, lets you know just where the picture will be taken.
Comments: I got a great deal on this, just as I expect from NewEgg

Title: great camera
Cons: bought it when it was still $xxx
Pros: high res, easy to use, small and nice looking

Cons: Comes with a useless 32mb memory card.  Don't plan on taking more than 10 pics with this.  You can make movies with the camera, but the quality isn't that clear.  It does serve its purpose though.
Pros: Takes excellent pics.  It fits in the palm of my hand.  I can just put it in my pocket and bring it anywhere with me.
Comments: When you buy this make sure you get a bigger memory card.  I got the SONY 1GB MS Pro Model MSX-1GS to supplement my camera.  Get it here from Newegg.

Title: Great Job by Newegg
Cons: None yet. I will let you know what happens when I drop it ;)
Pros: Very compact yet uber powerful. The great resolution makes photo editing in Photoshop very nice. No probs w/ blurry pics, just hold still and shoot, ez as pie. Also, great service by newegg.com once again.

Cons: I haven't found a driver for XP 64 bit to communicate with the camera, so I'll have to upload them to my powerbook then send to PC.
Pros: Good clear detailed pictures. Not much of a digital camera user so I have nothing to compare to, but the ease of use and quality are great for the price.

Title: So good!!!!
Cons: Typical Sony software...so proprietary it isn't worth using.
Pros: Small, light weight, easy to use even for the "non-believer" of digital cameras.  Great clarity of view finder.  Quick response time on picture to memory.  Hold over 250 pics on a 1GB Memory Stick.  Comes with a good audio/visual tuturial of how to take good digital camera pics...GREAT BUY!
Comments: If you don't buy this, you are missing out, BIG TIME!

Title: Sony makes good?
Cons: Minimal optical zoom. Not amazing in low light.
Pros: Longish battery life. Lots of picture quality/size settings. Pictures are gorgeous.
Comments: Bought as a gift for my girlfriend. We were replacing a previous Sony camera, which had a faulty lens. We learned that Sony produced many of that model with the bad lens, and was not friendly about replacing/repairing them. So we felt like this was a gamble, but we have been pleased so far.

Title: Sony has a real winner here.
Cons: The Sony software included with the camera is junk.  In fact, it seems to be suited more to a camcorder that a digital camera.  I simply uninstalled the Sony software and use the software that came with Windows XP.  It does everything I need and is much easier to use than the Sony software.
Pros: Great camera.  The response is much faster than any of the digital cameras I've used in the past.  Press the shutter button and the camera will focus and shoot very quickly without that typical digital camera lag.  Perfect size - small enough to put in your pocket, but big enough that it is easy to hold.  The picture quality is great and the battery lasts a decent amount of time.
Comments: You definitely need the biggest media card you can afford.  I got a 1gb card and at the cameras highest setting (7.2mb on fine setting - which is the lowest compression), the card can hold 288 pictures.  You can roughly double that number by using 7.2mb but on the standard setting (higher compression).  I find that as long as I regularly transfer the images to my computer, even using the highest settings gives me plenty of storage.  If I was going on a trip and wouldn't have access to my computer, then I would probably have to increase the compression to fit more pictures on the card.
